ygData.subject: Re: [Re: Market in EQ]
ygData.msgSnippet: If only player made items became worn and in need of repair that might help.  But at the same time, that would make a stronger market for bronze armor since
ygData.messageBody:
If only player made items became worn and in need of repair that might help. But at the same time, that would make a stronger market for bronze armor since you wouldn't have to worry about maintenance on it.

>>> "Paul Hill" <paul@...> 7.14.99 10:26:19 AM >>>
From: "Paul Hill" <paul@...>

Only items that a smith can make should be repairable hence become worn.
Since magic armor is rare and hard to get why should that item have to be
repaired, or become worn?

Karudil the Wandering Shaman of Ro

----- Original Message -----
From: Jason Coan <COANJ@...>
To: <EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, July 14, 1999 10:09 AM
Subject: Re: [Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Market in EQ]


> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
> OK, simple question, how many of you people that are for items
deteriorating and going poof have any magic plate? (none I'd bet)
>
> I've spent about 2 months to get the armor that I am now wearing, I'd be
pissed to an extreem if I were in the middle of a fight and I see a message
"Your Charred Black Tunic has fallen appart". That one piece of armor alone
took me the better part of week to get.
>
> Ok, so you say I should have to get it repaired by a smith. I am DE, and
by choice I have lowered my faction to the point where I will never be able
to go into Freeport or Rivervale, and due to built in factions, I can not go
to any other elf city nor can I go into gnome, dwarf, or barbarian city.
Which means that I would have to search, not only for a respectable smith
that I trusted, but also an evil one, or trek my self across the world to
Qeynos. Simply to get my armor "repaired". Now if that isn't bad
enough.....
>
> Often my group will go deep into a dungeon, deep to the point where either
a caster has to group gate us to get us out, or we have to spend 30-45 min
fighting out way out of the dungeon. And quite often we'll all camp and
logout in a "safe" spot in the dungeon, so sometimes we will be in a dungeon
litterly for days. Now, say I get the message "your rubicite helm is
begining to weaken, you should take it for repairs soon", that means that my
entire group would have to leave the dungeon so that I might quest to get my
armor repaired.
>
> I find neither to be acceptable. What I do find about this, is that there
are some smiths who think they don't make enough money, so they want armor
to wear out, so it has to either be replaced or repaired (more money for
smiths). What they fail to concider is the fact that you will not always be
wearing banded armor.
